member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferType
member.summary: Represents the type of call transfer to be performed during an asynchronous session.
member.remarks: When the event is raised, the property on the instance indicates the transfer type. When the event is raised, the property on the instance indicates the transfer type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferType.Blind
member.summary: The application redirects the caller to the recipient without remaining in the connection, and does not monitor the outcome. The exits the page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferType.Bridge
member.summary: The application redirects the caller to the recipient and remains in the connection. Document interpretation suspends until the transferred call terminates.
member.remarks: The Bridge transfer type is not supported in this version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferType.Consultation
member.summary: The application redirects the caller to the recipient and monitors the progress of the transfer until the connection is established between caller and recipient. If the connection is established, the Browser disconnects from the session.
member.remarks: The Consultation transfer type is not supported in this version.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.SessionState
member.summary: Represents possible states for an asynchronous VoiceXML session.

remarks.para: When the event is raised, the property on the instance indicates the session state.

Note: Although the TransferType enumeration contains all three types of transfer defined in the VoiceXML 2.1 standard, the current version of the VoiceXML runtime supports only the Blind transfer type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.SessionState.Idle
member.summary: The is not running.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.SessionState.Active
member.summary: The Browser is processing a or a method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason
member.summary: Contains a list of reasons that indicate why a instance exited from a VoiceXML page.
member.remarks: The property of the class gets the ExitReason when the Browser exits a VoiceXML page. For synchronous Browser instances, the VoiceXmlResult is returned by the method. For asynchronous Browser instances, initiated with the method, the class contains the VoiceXmlResult.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.None
member.summary: No exit reason is given.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.HostExitRequested
member.summary: The application called the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.ExitElementEncountered
member.summary: The VoiceXML interpreter encountered and processed an <exit> element on a VoiceXML page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.DialogEndEncountered
member.summary: The VoiceXML interpreter arrived at the end of a dialog and there was no successor element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.UnhandledPageException
member.summary: An exception is thrown in processing the VoiceXML page that is not handled by the VoiceXML <error> element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.MalFormedXml
member.summary: The Browser encountered errors in the syntax or structure of the VoiceXML page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.ServerNotAvailable
member.summary: The server that contains the VoiceXML start page could not be contacted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.AudioTerminated
member.summary: The audio that was present at the input connection can no longer be detected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.PageNotFound
member.summary:
The page specified by the URI parameter in a or
method could not be retrieved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.ExitReason.UnknownExit
member.summary: The reason for the exit could not be determined.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferState
member.summary: Represents the state of a VoiceXML phone call transfer request during an asynchronous session.
member.remarks:
When the event is raised, the property on the instance indicates the transfer state.
When the event is raised, the property on the instance indicates the transfer state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferState.None
member.summary: The state for the transfer was not given.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferState.Transferring
member.summary: A call transfer is in progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferState.Transferred
member.summary: The call transfer to the recipient was successful.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferState.Failed
member.summary: The call transfer to the recipient was not successful, for example there was no answer or the line was busy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.TransferState.UnknownError
member.summary: There was an error during transfer, but its cause could not be determined.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.DisconnectState
member.summary: Represents the possible states of a VoiceXML disconnect request during an asynchronous session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.DisconnectState.None
member.summary: There was no reason for the disconnection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.DisconnectState.UserDisconnected
member.summary: The caller discontinued the call, for example by hanging up.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.DisconnectState.HostDisconnected
member.summary: The application disconnected from the VoiceXML session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.DisconnectState.PageDisconnected
member.summary: The Browser is no longer connected to the VoiceXML page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.DisconnectState.ConnectionError
member.summary: There was an error in the connection to a call or an audio input that caused the Browser session to end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.DisconnectState.UnknownError
member.summary: There was a disconnect error but its cause could not be determined.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.RecognitionType
member.summary: Represents the type of input that was detected during an asynchronous Browser session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.RecognitionType.Speech
member.summary: The input collected matched one or more grammars that were referenced by, or included in, the VoiceXML document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.RecognitionType.Dtmf
member.summary: The input collected was of the type dual tone multi-frequency (DTMF); tones produced by pressing the buttons on a phone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Common.RecognitionType.Recorder
member.summary: The input was captured and stored in an audio file format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser
member.summary: The Browser class in the Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml namespace provides platform-independent access to the VoiceXML runtime.

remarks.para: Browser is an abstract class that provides a base from which to derive platform-specific classes. The Browser class cannot be used directly. Most developers will use a platform-specific VoiceXML Browser class that derives from the base Browser class.

An active Browser instance contains a VoiceXML interpreter and the system resources that are required to process an automated interaction with a caller including speech engines, a Dual-Tone Multi-Frequency (DTMF) tone controller, a recorder, and connections to audio inputs and outputs.
You can launch a Browser instance in either synchronous or asynchronous mode.
NOTE: Only use the synchronous method for prototyping and experimentation. Do not use it in a production application.

During an asynchronous Browser session, events are raised that report the state of the session to the application. At the end of an asynchronous Browser session, the handler for the event contains information about the result of the session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.Run(System.Uri,System.Net.CookieContainer)
member.summary: Launches a synchronous instance of the VoiceXML and specifies the URI of the VoiceXML start page to load, and a CookieContainer parameter.
member.param: Contains state information associated with a request for a VoiceXML page. The value can be null.
The URI of the VoiceXML start page to load.
member.returns: A VoiceXMLResult object that references the synchronous operation.
member.exception: Thrown when the Run method is called and the URI of the VoiceXML start page to load contains a null argument value.
Thrown when the Run method is called on a Browser instance that is running.

remarks.para: When initiated, the Run method checks the value of the Browser's property to determine if the Browser is already running. If Browser.State equals Active, then the Browser is running and the Run method throws an InvalidOperationException. If Browser.State equals Idle, then the Run method sets Browser.State to Active and launches the Browser instance.

You can instantiate and run multiple Browser objects simultaneously, for example Browser1, Browser2, Browser3. You cannot run the same Browser instance concurrently on multiple sessions, for example Browser1(a), Browser1(b), Browser1(c).

Upon successful completion of a VoiceXML page, the Run method returns a object, which may include a CookieContainer object with state information about the session for use by the Web server serving the VoiceXML documents.

If the session completes without errors, that is if the value is HostExitRequested, ExitElementEncountered, or DialogEndEncountered, then the
will be null.

members.member:
Launches an asynchronous instance of the VoiceXML , specifying the URI of the VoiceXML start page to load, and a CookieContainer parameter.
/// Contains state information associated with a request for a VoiceXML page. The value can be null.
The URI of the VoiceXML start page to load.
Thrown when the RunAsync method is called and the URI of the VoiceXML start page to load contains a null argument value.
Thrown when the RunAsync method is called on a Browser instance that is running.
When initiated, the RunAsync method checks the value of the Browser's property to determine if the Browser is already running. If Browser.State equals Active, then the Browser is running and the RunAsync method throws an InvalidOperationException. If Browser.State equals Idle, then the RunAsync method sets Browser.State to Active and launches the Browser instance.
You can instantiate and run multiple Browser objects simultaneously, for example Browser1, Browser2, Browser3. You cannot run the same Browser instance concurrently on multiple sessions, for example Browser1(a), Browser1(b), Browser1(c).
The Browser may raise any of the following events during an asynchronous session: , , , , or . The SessionCompleted event is raised at the end of an asynchronous Browser session, and represents the result of the Browser session with a object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.StopAsync
member.summary: Terminates the processing of a VoiceXML page, but allows the to finish processing the current VoiceXML element.
member.remarks:
The StopAsync method resets the Browser state, freeing the Browser for a new session. If the Browser has already stopped, calling StopAsync has no effect.
You can override the StopAsync method to customize its functionality.

member.remarks: When the event is raised, the property on the instance contains a object, which has information about the result of the session.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo
member.summary: This class encapsulates audio input information for speech recognition and audio output information for speech synthesis.
member.remarks: The AudioIOInfo class caches information regarding a call to any of the methods that set the input for the speech reconition engine or the output for the speech synthesis engine, so that the information can be applied when the Browser is invoked using the Run() or RunAsync() methods.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.audioIOtype
member.summary: Retains the audio input and output type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.audioStream
member.summary: The input and output audio stream specified, if any.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.audioFormat
member.summary: The format specified for the audio in the input or output stream, if any.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.path
member.summary: The source input file path or the target output file path specified, if any.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.#ctor(Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AudioIOInfo class.
member.param: AudioIOType

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.MakeAudioIOInfoForAudioStream(System.IO.Stream,Microsoft.Speech.AudioFormat.SpeechAudioFormatInfo)
member.summary: Acquires information about calls made to the SetInputToAudioStream and SetOutputToAudioStream methods.
member.param: The stream connected to the audio input and the stream connected to the audio output.
The format of the audio in the input and output streams.
member.returns: An AudioIOInfo object that contains information for calls made to the SetInputToAudioStream and SetOutputToAudioStream methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.MakeAudioIOInfoForDefaultAudioDevice
member.summary: Acquires information about calls made to the SetInputToDefaultAudioDevice and SetOutputToDefaultAudioDevice methods.
member.returns: An AudioIOInfo object that contains information for calls made to the SetInputToDefaultAudioDevice and SetOutputToDefaultAudioDevice methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.MakeAudioIOInfoForNull
member.summary: Acquires information about calls made to the SetInputToNull and SetOutputToNull methods.
member.returns: An AudioIOInfo object that contains information for calls made to the SetInputToNull and SetOutputToNull methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.MakeAudioIOInfoForWaveFile(System.String)
member.summary: Acquires information about calls made to the SetInputToWaveFile and SetOutputToWaveFile methods.
member.param: The path to the .WAV file to be used as intput and the path to the .WAV file to be used as output.
member.returns: An AudioIOInfo object that contains information for calls made to the SetInputToWaveFile and SetOutputToWaveFile methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.MakeAudioIOInfoForWaveStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Acquires information about calls made to the SetInputToWaveStream and SetOutputToWaveStream methods.
member.param: Stream
member.returns: An AudioIOInfo object that contains information for calls made to the SetInputToWaveStream and SetOutputToWaveStream methods.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType
member.summary: Represents the type of audio input and audio output that the Browser client has specified for speech recognition and speech synthesis, respectively.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType.Unspecified
member.summary: The type of the audio input and the audio output is Unspecified after a Browser run completes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType.Null
member.summary: The type of the audio input and the audio output is Null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType.DefaultDevice
member.summary: The type of the audio input is the system default audio input device and the type of audio output is the system default audio output device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType.AudioStream
member.summary: The type of the audio input and the audio output is audio stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType.WaveFile
member.summary: The type of the audio input and the audio output is .WAV format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.AudioIOInfo.AudioIOType.WaveStream
member.summary: The type of the audio input and the audio output is .WAV stream.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy
member.summary: The CallProxy class is used by classes that derive from to pass information about calls to the VoiceXML interpreter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the CallProxy object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.NotifyStateChanged(System.Object,Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState,Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason)
member.summary: Raises a StateChanged event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.NotifyToneReceived(System.Object,Microsoft.Speech.Recognition.DtmfTone)
member.summary: Raises a ToneReceived event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.NotifyTransferStateChanged(System.Object,Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState)
member.summary: Raises a TransferStateChanged event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.NotifyOpenCompleted(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Raises an OpenCompleted event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.NotifyRecorderStopped(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Exception)
member.summary: Raises a RecorderStopped event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.BeginTerminate(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Terminates the call. A terminated call is no longer usable.
member.param: A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous operation from other asynchronous operations.
The method to be called when the asynchronous operation is completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.EndTerminate(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: This method is used to determine whether the corresponding operation completed successfully. This method will wait if the operation has not yet completed.
member.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.BeginAccept(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Accepts an incoming call.
member.param: A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous operation from other asynchronous operations.
The method to be called when the asynchronous operation is completed.
member.remarks: The state of the call can change if the remote party decides to cancel the call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.EndAccept(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: This method is used to determine whether the corresponding operation completed successfully. This method will wait if the operation has not yet completed.
member.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous operation.
member.exception: Thrown when this method is invoked multiple times using the same asyncResult.
Thrown when the result parameter is null.
Thrown when the result parameter is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.BeginTransfer(System.String,System.Boolean,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initiates a transfer request to the remote participant.
member.param: Boolean value that is true if the transfer is attended.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous operation from other asynchronous operations.
The transfer target URI.
The method to be called when the asynchronous operation is completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.BeginTransfer(System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initiates a transfer request to the remote participant.
member.param: A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous operation from other asynchronous operations.
The URI of the transfer target.
The method to be called when the asynchronous operation is completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.BeginTransferSupervised
member.summary: Initiates a supervised transfer request to the remote participant.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.EndTransfer(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: The EndTransfer method is used to determine whether the corresponding operation completed successfully. This method will wait if the operation has not yet completed.
member.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous operation.
member.exception: Thrown when this method is invoked multiple times using the same asyncResult.
Thrown when the result parameter is null.
Thrown when the result parameter is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.OpenAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Accepts an incoming telephony session invite and sends a response.
member.param: The SipUri of the calling party.
The SipUri of the final destination.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.StartRecording(System.String,Microsoft.Speech.AudioFormat.EncodingFormat)
member.summary: Begins recording audio input from the call.
member.param: The Codec to use for recording.
The name and path of the file to which audio will be recorded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.StopRecording
member.summary: Stops recording audio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.TransferTypeRequested
member.summary: Gets the transfer type of the requested transfer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.TargetSip
member.summary: Gets and sets the SIP for call transfers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.LocalParticipantUri
member.summary: Gets the URI of the local call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.RemoteParticipantUri
member.summary: Gets the URI of the remote call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.State
member.summary: Gets the current call state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.CallId
member.summary: Gets the CallID of the current call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.RecorderState
member.summary: Gets the state of the Recorder.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState
member.summary: The ProxyCallState enumeration is used to relay information about the current call state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Idle
member.summary: The call is idle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Incoming
member.summary: The call has just been received.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Establishing
member.summary: The call establishment is in progress after initiating or accepting the call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Established
member.summary: The call is established.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Transferring
member.summary: The call has initiated a transfer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Terminating
member.summary: The call is terminating.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Terminated
member.summary: The call has terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallState.Parking
member.summary: The call is to be put on hold.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyTransferType
member.summary: Indicates the type of transfer requested in the VoiceXML document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyTransferType.None
member.summary: No transfer type is given.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyTransferType.Bridge
member.summary: The application redirects the caller to the recipient and remains in the connection. Document interpretation suspends until the transferred call terminates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyTransferType.Blind
member.summary: The application redirects the caller to the recipient without remaining in the connection, and does not monitor the outcome. The exits the page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyTransferType.Consultation
member.summary: The application redirects the caller to the recipient and monitors the progress of the transfer until the connection is established between caller and recipient. If the connection is established, the Browser disconnects from the session.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason
member.summary: Represents the reasons for call state transitions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.None
member.summary: Unspecified or unknown reason.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.Ringing
member.summary: One of the remote endpoints is ringing. This reason is only raised once.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.CallDelayed
member.summary: The call is delayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.Establishing
member.summary: The call is being initiated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.Accepted
member.summary: The call is being accepted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.Established
member.summary: Call establishment is completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.EstablishFailed
member.summary: Call establishment failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.TerminatedLocally
member.summary: The local participant has terminated the call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.TerminatedRemotely
member.summary: The remote participant has terminated the call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.Canceled
member.summary: The call has been canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.TransferredLocally
member.summary: The call has been transferred by the local participant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.TransferredRemotely
member.summary: The call has been transferred by the remote participant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.TransferSent
member.summary: The transfer message was sent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.TransferAccepted
member.summary: The incoming transfer request was accepted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.TransferFailed
member.summary: The transfer operation failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.CallTransferred
member.summary: The call was transferred successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.Terminated
member.summary: The call was terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.Deflected
member.summary: No reason was specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.DeflectedWithUnknownReason
member.summary: The reason specified is unknown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.DeflectedToAnotherDestination
member.summary: The call is being forwarded to another target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.DeflectedToTeam
member.summary: The call is being forwarded as a team call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.DeflectedToDelegate
member.summary: The call is being forwarded to a delegate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.DeflectedByAutomaticCallDistributor
member.summary: The call is being forwarded to an automatic call distributor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.CallParked
member.summary: The call has been put on hold.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.ParkFailed
member.summary: The attempt to put the call on hold failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyCallStateTransitionReason.CallReplaced
member.summary: The call was replaced with another call.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyRecorderState
member.summary: Represents the state of the recorder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyRecorderState.Started
member.summary: The recorder is recording.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyRecorderState.Stopped
member.summary: The recorder is stopped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyRecorderState.Paused
member.summary: The recorder is paused.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState
member.summary: Indicates possible states for the signaling session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.Idle
member.summary: The refer has not been sent yet.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.ReferRequested
member.summary: The refer message has been sent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.ReferAccepted
member.summary: The refer has been accepted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.ReferRejected
member.summary: The refer has been rejected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.ReferFailed
member.summary: The refer operation was not sent successfully or did not receive a response.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.Trying
member.summary: The refer target is being connected by the remote participant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.Alerted
member.summary: The refer target has been alerted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.Succeeded
member.summary: The refer operation was completed successfully by the remote participant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.Failed
member.summary: The refer operation was not completed successfully by the remote participant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyReferState.Redirected
member.summary: The refer target has redirected but the redirect was not acted upon.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState
member.summary: Represents the state of an attempt to load a VoiceXML document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.Success
member.summary: The page is loaded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.StartPageInInvalidUri
member.summary: The URI given for the start page is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.VoiceXmlBrowserFailedToLoadPage
member.summary: The could not load the start page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.VoiceXmlGeneralError
member.summary: An error occurred in processing the page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.VoiceXmlGeneralWarning
member.summary: A non-fatal error occurred in processing the page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.PageNotFound
member.summary: The page specified by the URI could not be retrieved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.ServerNotAvailable
member.summary: The server that contains the VoiceXML start page could not be contacted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Speech.VoiceXml.Browser.CallProxy.ProxyPageState.MalFormedXml
member.summary: There is an error in the syntax or structure of the VoiceXML page.
